name: Tin Mine falls
description:
Introduction

This canyon is described in comprehensive detail in Canyoning Around Victoria guidebook

Approach

As per the map. 25km walk or mountainbike ride to get to the start.

Descent

All anchors are on river right. The longest abseil is the last one @ 60m. the penultimate abseil has a very exposed traverse to the main anchor tucked around the TR.

Exit

Up the scree from the last abseil, then to a small ledge (with a spring) which crosses the fierce headwall, the zigzap up the loose scree, back to the top.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
